function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reduced air pollution from lockdown may lead to complacency and a return to high pollution levels post-lockdown.","Impact":"If not mitigated, a return to high levels of air pollution could lead to respiratory problems and other health issues for the public.","Mitigation":"Continued monitoring of air pollution levels and implementation of strict regulations to control industrial pollution post-lockdown.","Technologies":"Air quality monitoring systems, emission control technologies, and enforcement systems for industrial regulations.","People":"General public, especially those living in highly polluted areas.","Owner":"Environmental protection agencies, government bodies, and industrial stakeholders."},{"Description":"Reduction in power consumption during lockdown may lead to a surge in power demand post-lockdown, potentially straining the power grid.","Impact":"If not mitigated, a sudden surge in power demand could lead to power outages and grid instability.","Mitigation":"Forecasting and planning for the post-lockdown power demand, implementation of demand-side management strategies, and reinforcement of the power grid infrastructure.","Technologies":"Smart grid technologies, energy storage systems, demand response systems.","People":"Residential and industrial consumers, power grid operators.","Owner":"Power utilities, regulatory authorities, and energy management organizations."}]}
